poem:
**In the Valley of Merlin**

In Cornish seams of green,  
among knotted oaks where time  
meets its reflection, he walks,  
this man of dual truths.  
Earth's whisper holds his name,  
her moss-clad fingers grasping  
at his soul, drawing him  
to the Mother Tree's shade—  
where hollowed roots  
cradle broken echoes, healing anew.
